author: D Madhavan
text:
Eight families living at the dilapidated structure escape unhurt

A few children escaped unhurt as they were pulled out of danger by a few youngsters when a portion of a dilapidated two-storey building collapsed on Muthu Gramani Street in Purasawalkam on Monday evening. The incident took place around 8 p.m.

These children were playing in front of the portion of the building that crumbled.

“We were chatting with our friends and a few children were playing in front of the building. Some people on the opposite side of the lane shouted to us that the building was falling. We immediately dragged the children along with us,” said 32-year-old T. Magendran, a tenant. Over 50 years old, the building has eight tenants. Each family shares around 200 sq.ft. of space as their rented accommodation. There are deep cracks on the ceilings, walls of the building.

“A few months ago, a portion of the ceiling collapsed. Luckily, no one was injured then too,” said 65-year-old I. Malathi. Residents blamed poor maintenance of the building for the accident. The building, they said, belonged to Gunasekar, a smalltime artist in films and a resident of Sowcarpet. The immediate cause, residents said, might be the demolition of another old building adjacent to the existing dilapidated building as both buildings were supporting each other. No case has been registered by the Vepery police.
title: Building collapses in Purasawalkam
